messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] bouncing mail
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/1/03 10:44:08 AM, leschke@shaw.ca writes:  Sandra is right that mail sent to the old unschooling-dotcom address ...
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/1/03 10:44:08 AM, leschke@... writes:

<< > Sandra is right that mail sent to the old unschooling-dotcom address

> will bounce.


<<But replies wouldn't bounce. >>

I had a reply bounce yesterday. I had to cut and paste the response into a
new mail and copy over the new address.

Replies to the NEW address won't bounce.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] bouncing mail
messages.msgSnippet: ... But replies wouldn t bounce. Tia They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.  Ben
messages.messageBody:
> Sandra is right that mail sent to the old unschooling-dotcom address
> will bounce.

But replies wouldn't bounce.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.messageBody:
***She's right about a lot more than that, too, but I'd rather discuss
unschooling with her than discuss her.***

I got carried away.

I'm going to find a good movie and brush my cat.

Deb L

messages.subject: bouncing mail
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra is right that mail sent to the old unschooling-dotcom address will bounce. She s right about a lot more than that, too, but I d rather discuss
messages.messageBody:
Sandra is right that mail sent to the old unschooling-dotcom address
will bounce.

She's right about a lot more than that, too, but I'd rather discuss
unschooling with her than discuss her.

-pam
